get.summary: GetDeviceList allows to retrieve a list of all currently monitored network devices.

post.summary:
AddDevice allows to add a network device that would be monitored.
Response will contain device ID assigned internally by the system.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: AddDeviceRequest message carries network device that is necessary to add to the monitoring.

patch.summary:
UpdateDeviceList allows to update list of the devices that are currently monitored in a PATCH fashion.
Response contains full list of monitored network devices reflecting recent changes.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: UpdateDeviceListRequest contains a list of the devices (including theirs' details) to be updated.

delete.summary:
DeleteDevice allows to remove network device from the monitoring service.
In order to do so, you should remember ID assigned internally by the monitoring system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal (for the system) ID of the device.

get.summary: GetDeviceStatus allows to retrieve network device status in real time.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal (to the system) ID of the device.

parameters.name: endpoint.host
parameters.description: Host address in CIDR form of IP or FQDN, if applicable.

parameters.name: endpoint.port
parameters.description: Port number, where device health point is reachable.

parameters.name: endpoint.protocol
parameters.description:
Supported by the network device protocol for communicating over this endpoint.

 - PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED: This is to comply with Protobuf best practices.
 - PROTOCOL_SNMP: Corresponds to the SNMP protocol.
 - PROTOCOL_NETCONF: Corresponds to the NETCONF protocol.
 - PROTOCOL_RESTCONF: Corresponds to the RESTCONF protocol.
 - PROTOCOL_OPEN_V_SWITCH: Corresponds to the Open vSwitch protocol.

get.summary: GetSummary allows to retrieve summary of network device monitoring.

DeviceMonitoringServiceDeleteDeviceBody.description: DeleteDeviceRequest carries information about the network device that should be removed from the monitoring.

apiv1Status.description:
Status defines Finite State Machine (FSM) for network device monitoring.

 - STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: This is to comply with Protobuf best practices.
 - STATUS_DEVICE_DOWN: Corresponds to Network device is in down (or not reachable state).
 - STATUS_DEVICE_UNHEALTHY: Corresponds to the Network device in unhealthy state (as defined internally by the device).
 - STATUS_DEVICE_UP: Corresponds to the Network device in healthy state (i.e., up and running, operating as expected).

v1AddDeviceRequest.description: AddDeviceRequest message carries network device that is necessary to add to the monitoring.

device.description: Network device (with assigned internal ID) that has been added to the system.

added.description: A bool variable to indicate success/failure of the ADD operation.

details.description: In case of failure, carries additional information about the reason of failure. Otherwise, empty.

v1AddDeviceResponse.description: AddDeviceResponse carries information about the device that has been added to the monitoring and status of the operation.

id.description: Internal (to the system) ID of the device.

deleted.description: A bool variable that indicates the success/failure of the operation.

details.description: In case of failure, carries additional data, otherwise, empty.

v1DeleteDeviceResponse.description: DeleteDeviceResponse carries information about network device that has been removed from the monitoring.

status.description: Current status of the Network device.

lastSeen.description: A timestamp when the device was last seen in the UP or unhealthy state.

v1DeviceStatus.description: DeviceStatus reports the status opf the network device including the time when it was last seen in the UP or unhealthy state.

host.description: Host address in CIDR form of IP or FQDN, if applicable.

port.description: Port number, where device health point is reachable.

protocol.description: Supported by the network device protocol for communicating over this endpoint.

v1GetDeviceListResponse.description: GetDeviceListResponse contains full list of the network devices within the monitoring system.

id.description: Internal (to the system) ID of the device.

endpoint.description: Internal (to the system) ID of the device.

v1GetDeviceStatusResponse.description: GetDeviceStatusResponse carries the result of the health check for the network device.

devicesTotal.description: Total number of the monitored network devices.

devicesUp.description: Total number of devices in UP state.

downDevices.description: Total number of devices in DOWN state.

v1GetSummaryResponse.title: GetSummaryResponse provides a summary of the network device monitoring statistics,

id.description:
ID is a device ID assigned internally by the Monitoring service. it is internal to the system.
Later, by this ID, it is possible to retrieve any information about the device.

endpoint.description: Network device endpoint. Device may contain several network endpoints (e.g., support of different protocols).

hwVersion.description: HW version (i.e., HW revision, different from model version).

v1NetworkDevice.title: NetworkDevice message defines Network device data structure,

v1Protocol.title: Protocol enum defines the supported protocols by monitoring service

v1UpdateDeviceListResponse.description: UpdateDeviceListResponse contains full list of the network devices within the system, once update has been performed.

v1Vendor.description:
Vendor enum defines Network Device vendors, which are supported by the system.

 - VENDOR_UNSPECIFIED: This is to comply with Protobuf best practices.
 - VENDOR_UBIQUITI: Ubiquiti,
 - VENDOR_CISCO: Cisco.
 - VENDOR_JUNIPER: Juniper Networks.

v1Version.description: Version message is a generic message for reporting a version.
